alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Lycoming; Montour; Northumberland; Sullivan; Union (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 18 at 1:41AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Columbia, Lycoming, Montour, Northumberland, Sullivan and Union. * WHEN...Until 430 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Small streams and creeks are elevated. Ponding of water in urban areas may occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 136 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Heavy rains will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall of 0.5 to 1 inches is expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Williamsport, Bloomsburg, Berwick, Milton, Lewisburg, Danville, Montoursville, Mifflinburg, Muncy, Watsontown, Hughesville, Montgomery, Linntown, Mifflinville, Duboistown, Lightstreet, New Columbia, Montandon, Fernville and Allenwood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Columbia; Lycoming; Montour; Northumberland; Sullivan; Union
